sentences.english: Is there someone who can be my mediator, my vindicator before God?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有人可以在神面前作爲我的中保和辯護人？

sentences.english: A barrister or a group of barrister is referred to as "counsel".
sentences.chinese: 一個或一組高級律師也稱之爲辯護人。

sentences.english: The advocate was held in contempt for subpoenaing the judge.
sentences.chinese: 辯護人因傳喚法官而被判藐視法庭。

sentences.english: What the defender has just said is neither there nor there. He should try to keep to the topic.
sentences.chinese: 剛纔辯護人說的都是題外話，他應該抓住主題。

sentences.english: The accused in a private prosecution has the right to entrust defenders at any time.
sentences.chinese: 自訴案件的被告人有權隨時委託辯護人。

sentences.english: A barrister or a group of barristers is referred to as 'counsel'.
sentences.chinese: 一個或一組高級狀師也稱之爲辯護人。

sentences.english: His counsel counseled him to say nothing about the affair before they met.
sentences.chinese: 他的辯護人勸告他在他們會面之前保持沉默。

sentences.english: The next question from counsel left the witness flounder about for an answer.
sentences.chinese: 辯護人提出的下一個問題使證人吱吱晤晤答不上來。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
